channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Carol of the Bells’ Once Filled the Air Here. Now It’s Only Bombs.
item.description: Mykola Leontovych, the Ukrainian composer of the famed festive song, lived in the eastern city of Pokrovsk. Months of Russian assaults have erased mos...

item.title: Pope Leo Surprises St. Peter’s Crowd Before Christmas Eve Mass
item.description: Pope Leo XIV greeted the soggy faithful in St. Peter’s Square in both English and Italian and apologized that there wasn’t enough room in the basilica...

item.title: California farming mogul in bitter divorce proceedings arrested on suspicion of murdering his wife
item.description: Michael Abatti has grown onions, broccoli and cantaloupes and served on the board of the powerful Imperial Irrigation District from 2006 to 2010.

item.title: Drummer cancels Christmas Eve ‘Jazz Jams’ at Kennedy Center after name change, ending 20-year tradition
item.description: “When I saw the name change on the Kennedy Center website and then hours later on the building, I chose to cancel our concert,” Chuck Redd told the AP...

item.title: Martin Scorsese: Rob Reiner Had Me in the Palm of His Hand
item.description: “We had a natural affinity for each other,” Martin Scorsese writes of Rob Reiner.

item.title: Heavy Rains and Floods Threaten California on Christmas Day
item.description: Much of Southern California remained at risk of potentially deadly floods on Thursday, as heavy rains showed little sign of easing through the week.

item.title: Goldman Sachs expects layoffs to keep rising—and says investors are punishing the stocks of companies that slash staff
item.description: Analysts ran the numbers and found a surprising change in how investors are reacting to layoff announcements.

item.title: Telluride resort owner rips into ski patrol union after strikes shuts down slopes on Christmas
item.description: The Telluride Professional Ski Patrol Association voted to strike Saturday after contract negotiations since June failed to yield an agreement on pay.

item.title: The global empathy crisis that confronts us this Christmas
item.description: Empathy levels diminished 14% across the U.S. after the pandemic, with the steepest drop among millennials, according to a United Way survey.

item.title: With Airspace Closed, a Lonely Christmas for Many Venezuelans
item.description: The holidays usually bring home huge numbers from the Venezuelan diaspora. But this year, after international airlines halted almost all service, many...

item.title: After Suffering in Israeli Prison, a Gaza Detainee Comes Home to More Pain
item.description: Haitham Salem spent 11 months held by Israel without charge and said he endured beatings and abuse. He was released as part of the cease-fire deal, lo...
